intro: Eriostemma suluense, commonly known as the Sulu eriostemma, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas within forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
